message: I bought a powered hub, and 2X of the following cables: MiniUSB, MicroUSB, iPhone.  I'm making a charging station (after leaving my phone cord at home one too many times.)  Am I missing any connectors that are widely used?  What should I use as a box/platform?
Induction charging? Box/platform? In what sense?
Just a platform, maybe with compartments to hold gadgets.  Needs to hide USB hub and cables.
How about a barrel-plug, like DC-in on Arduino? How big a platform?
Maybe like a foot square.  Maybe like an old shoe-shine box...
Maybe. So not portable, you mean. Maybe an ammo can? A hollowed-out "Retro" technology?
I like the idea of a hollowed out retro technology.  Maybe something with VU meters, or related to electricity...
Like an art deco radio or something?

Some pictures of charging stations http://www.google.com/search?q=charging+station&hl=en&prmd=ivns&source=lnms&tbm=isch&ei=Ppq7Tau3A4K3twfrxaC0BQ&sa=X&oi=mode_link&ct=mode&cd=2&ved=0CFkQ_AUoAQ&biw=1500&bih=1004
>hollowed out retro technology == Happy Days Lunchbox?
Dude, that's a Collectors' Item! Something with a lid IS probably best, though.
Why a lid?
Cables dragging around, getting bumped & tangled, protecting
Delicate parts
I just heard Obama's gonna announce they killed Bin Laden.... I heard this unofficially, but am inclined to believe the source.

Ha! I beat Twitter to breaking the news! But that doesn't seem important nor relevant. Maybe the lid idea came from a vaguely misguided mental picture I've formed of this Charging Station. Pls. Describe in detail, if you'd be so kind.
well @A1Ari mentioned using the redbull box.  I think that will be good...
nice
There will be a compartment to hide all of the electronics/end of cables, the tips of the cables will stick out and there will be platforms, compartments to lay phones, gadgets.
I've decided that one cable should be added: female USB, so that people can plug their weird/unsupported USB cables into it.  (My Nook Color has a weird USB cable.)
What about inductive charging? Is that difficult? I haven't a clue. If possible, a kit or class on that would be Sweet.
I think something that is low profile / flat on the wall will be good, have just the ends sticking out that you can plug in and stand the phone up...
something that can be flat wall mounted would be good
This could be cool, would have to reconfigure the shape, but it captures the right spirit.  http://cgi.ebay.com/Vintage-GE-Vacuum-Tube-Caddy-Case-tool-box-display-/110679939266
Inductive charging is a non-starter, requires gadget to support it.

Hrm, maybe something like this.  I could cut the front cover, move the logo to the bottom, hide the electronics on the bottom shelf behind that, and have the gadgets up top.  http://cgi.ebay.com/VTG-STEREO-NEEDLE-FIDELITONE-STORE-DISPLAY-WOOD-CABINET-/120717153689
http://blog.cartelagency.com/2008/11/12/the-best-charging-station-roundup-take-control-of-your-damn-gadgets/
http://blog.cartelagency.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/11/folio.jpg
That folio pictures is cool, but just so ppl are clear, that is not what I am talking about.
I gave that as an example of a low profile wall mounted device to mimic.

What about something like this?
http://cgi.ebay.com/Antique-Weston-AC-Volt-Meter-Model-155-No-2278-NR-/250813562552?pt=LH_DefaultDomain_0&hash=item3a65a73eb8
Hell yeah.  That captures the aesthetic perfectly.  I have to look some more and see how I'd mount the phones and stuff.  I might buy this.
Sweet Sweat!
Will be good to just have it like an octopus that you can keep on the table, move around, connect to your computer etc...
Inductive?
It should also have laptop chargers, mac, asus, etc... Array of retractable connectors...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inductive_charging
we're working on the inductive part of the charger
we need a 4 diode rectifier /  (boost converter)  battery cellphone charger - @rmd6502 has a boost converter here that we can use. - @psytek
I'll need to look up the performance of inductors vs frequency
okay, it's confirmed - the way I did it is the Old Way, which is inefficient - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inductive_charging
the new way uses higher frequencies - I'm thinking a 555 driving a NPN with a good current gain-bandwidth product.  Maybe 100KHz?
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003NEZG0O/
Yeah, I'll poke around for more info
I still think patents & instructables' dissections of commercial products would make things easier.
http://dvice.com/archives/2011/05/modified-18-whe.php
http://www.idaptweb.com/universal_chargers/i1_eco/
I was in Istanbul recently and these were all over (I wonder about monetizing possibilities here) - http://re-configure.org/Turkey/DSCN0248.JPG
Coins only makes sense in countries where 1-3 denomination coins are commonplace.  Text-message/carrier billing is where it is at... ;)  Or NFC when that gets up and running.
I didn't realize they had coin slots, thats awesome!  We have a coin acceptor...
We can use the battery from the old POV machine and the solar cells here to make a trickle charger.

Lets make one that can be chained to a pole, similar to a newspaper stand.  We'll have contact info on it in case there are any issues.  I'm pretty sure if we put it next to a newspaper stand it would fit right in.
Any danger this could be construed as a "suspicious package?"
that can be taken into the design considerations

Plugged everything in, and it did not work reliably.  Iphones would not charge.  Some droids would/would not charge on microUSB.  We're thinking that maybe the powered hub has some current sensing abilities, and it was overloaded. I am disappoint.  Will investigate this hub, and maybe get another hub.
Hrm, this is a maybe: http://cgi.ebay.com/VINTAGE-B-K-MODEL-445-CRT-TESTER-DYNASCAN-ELECTRONICS-/110695205888
